Yato grinned at the commotion. It seemed this was how the two felt with each other. It was still strange thinking of a animal spirit and vampire living together.

The two soon got up with Xavier resuming his meal and Ren finishing his noodles.

What was next?
155331111.title: Getting to Know a Fox And Vampire

choices: The Group Reacts to This and Keeps Chatting
1553311111.content:
"So wait...if you don't bite people...how is there more than one vampire?" Hiyori inquired curiously, having been writing this all down since it was pretty interesting.

"I trust you're not going to show anyone that." Xavier frowned, Hiyori 'eeped' and shook her head quickly.

"Good. Anyway, waaay back in my ancestor's day it was like that...but we've had to adapt through the centuries. We gotta be discreet otherwise we'll end up extinct. The only way for someone to become a vampire...well you can't really turn anyone into a full one." Xavier said casually.

"Wait...there are levels to how much of a vampire someone is?" Yukine asked, this was all pretty cool!

"Yeah, let's say I wanted to take an apprentice or something...then I'd do a process called 'blooding'. What it is is that you take the human's hand and have them face their palm up towards you. Then the vampire will take his fingernails and dig them into the tips of the human's fingers. There's blood...lots of it...but when the vampire seals the wounds with his saliva the person is a half-vampire officially."

"That's it?" Yato blinked curiously, they sure were learning a lot!

"What do you mean 'that's it'?" Xavier raised an eyebrow.

"Well it doesn't seem so bad..." Kofuku giggled.

"It's not like the halfie can go back to a normal life...all their human attachments have to be severed. That's why if you're taking on a young halfie that the most common method is to fake their death." Xavier explained.

"Wait...why?" Yukine asked, this was getting heavy.

"Because if they try to go back to a normal life...the thirst will overtake them...and who do you think they'll end up draining? Those closest to them. A newbie lacks the know-how to do it quietly and doesn't know how to show restraint...all they'll know is they need blood and are mad with the desire to drink." Xavier said seriously.

"Can't just go around making half-vampires willy nilly. You have to be sure that they're capable, that you are the mentor sort and can above all keep them in line. It isn't just tragic for the parties involved...but if it goes south it'd bring us all down with them." Xavier stated.
1553311111.title: More Questions

15533111111.content:
A thick silence filled the air as Xavier's words rang out over thier minds. The truth about vampires may be different from what they percieved but it still had many darks to it.

Yukine's eyes found thier way to his feet. His chest felt heavy as he thought over everything. Becoming a vampire was much like him when he became a shinki, having to live a new live when the old is gone. A child halfie could turn into a uncontrollable blood thirty monster just like he could've turned into a phantom.

Yukine felt a soft grasp to his hand he didn't know was clenched. Looking up, he saw Hiyori had come over and was looking at him with a gentle look, Yato was looking over with a soft look as well. The Shinki felt relief as he remembered how he was saved and expelled his sin.

Xavier grew a small grin as scooped up more rice. "Then again, Halfies can learn control when thier masters give them care and teachings."

Yukine smiled as the silence ended as everyone laughed. The blond boy looked over to Renard who was slurping up the rest of his noodles and passing the bowl over.

"So what does a Totem do?"

Ren leaned into his palm and and closed his eyes. "My duty ended a long time ago kid."

Yato felt his curiosity gripped. "How does a spirit lose it's duty?"

Ren's eyes opened and seem to hold a seriousness not seen before. "It wasn't just my duty, it was me and my tribe's task to watch over the land."

After Yukine gave the foxboy his new bowl, Ren hesitated in moving his chopsticks. Ren sighed before finally placing them down and looking at Yukine.

"I can tell you my story, but I got to warn all of you it ain't happy."

Kofuku slowly nodded. "It's ok tell away."

"Well it started 1000 years ago."

"1000 years!?", everyone but Xavier thought.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
"My tribe was known as The Creek, we were tasked with using our power to protect the human tribes who resided in our area."

Through the trees ran two foxes at fast speeds jumping over roots and rivers. After coming to a clearing the foxes suddenly glowed and took the form of humans with thier vulpine ears and tail. Ren was one of them dressed in brown loincloth and shaw, the other was a boy similar in looks except for longer hair. The two laughed as they layed on the grass.

"Me and my brother weren't finished with our training so we'd spent time goofing around. It was peaceful....but not for long."

The two Foxboys looked up in confusion as the sun was blacked out despite the cloudless sky. Ren and his brother gasped as they saw blackness filling the sky, strange demonic creatures were flying through the sky armed with red spears and swords. One had seen them and immediately shot at them, only to let out an unholy screech as Ren and his brother incinerated it with thier blue flames.

The two quickly changed into foxes and began sprinting back towards thier tribe's home. As they reached the large lake that was the halfway point, a demonic creature like that of a large bull emerged with a red axe appeared and took a fighting stance.

"Evil spirits known as Malice were attacking all the spirits tribes. As without them in the way, the Malice could corrupt humans no problem."

Ren's brother looked at him in fear, before he was pulled into a hug. The brother teared up as Ren signaled him to flee without him. Ren watched his brother in fox form leave before looking at the malice with a smirk as he rushed it.

"I put up a good fight but in the end I lost."

Ren looked down shocked at the bull had stabbed him with the point on his ax. The malice then threw his body into the lake and the last thing the foxboy saw was the surface going furthur away.

"I miraculously hadn't died but was put into a healing sleep that took it's damn time as I woke up a few hundred years later."

Ren's eyes shot open as he laid at the bottom of the lake. Shooting towards the surface the Totem collapsed onto the grass before getting up to limp back to his home.

"Hundreds of years may have been kind to me.....but not my tribe."

Ren looked around his tribal home in confusion. Usually everyone was running around full of energy but now it seem deserted. The foxboy smiled he saw his hut and rushed to pull open the entrance.

"My brother manage to escape my encounter with the malice. But he and the rest of my family weren't so lucky for the second encounter."

Ren's eyes were opened wide as his pupils shrunk. The walls of the hut had darkened stains and in the corner two large Skeletons were wrapped around a smaller one as if hugging it.

Ren covered his mouth as he backed away.
Streaks of liquid fell down his cheeks as he dropped to his knees. A loud anguished yell echoed throughout the village as Ren concluded the reason for the desertion.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
"After that, I wandered around and saw how much humanity changed. The humans my tripe protected either left thier homes or weren't around anymore."

Ren finally moved his chopped sticks and slurped up the noodles before grimacing. "Damn now it's cold."

What happens next?
15533111111.title: Dark Pasts Come Together

choices: Getting to know the overly loyal Larten!
155331111113.content:
Everyone felt bad for Renard after hearing his tragic story, they comforted him although he didn't necessarily show that he was tore up about it that much. "Let's not mope around about the past...it's depressing." Renard chuckled. "Right." Hiyori said slightly teary eyed.

Daikoku soon returned with groceries, "I see you did well keeping the place in order while I was away...well done, Yukine." Daikoku praised Yukine causing the blondie to blush.

"Oh yeah, I ran into this weirdo while I was out." Daikoku thumbed over his shoulder. Xavier happened to look up at that moment and spat out the tea he had been drinking all over the table. "WHAAAA-!?"

The man was tall and had long limbs, he wore a top hat and a long coat. "Your lordship!! I've found youuu!" The man broke down weeping and practically threw himself onto Xavier.

"Gaaagh!" Xavier cried out as he tried to shove the strange man off.

"OOoh boy...he's found us." Renard said sarcastically as he watched Xavier struggle.

"Who is this funny guy?" Kofuku chirped.

"He's Xavier's um....I dunno really. His name's Larten...and all I know is that he follows him around cause Xavier's the king of all vampires or something. So he's like a um...bodyguard or butler or something?" Ren said casually.

The three youths blanched, "He's a king?!" They cried out.

"Duh, what part of being the OG Dracula didn't you understand? Though he's not exactly responsible with his duties and all that..." Renard informed them.

"Would you stop crying on meee?!" Xavier wailed as he tried to escape the hysterically crying Larten's grip.
155331111113.title: Unexpected Visitor

choices: The end of the day came
1553311111131.content:
After the 'tender' reunion between king and butler, Larten placed a hand on his chest as rose petals seem to fall around him.

"I thank you for feeding my lord, if he ate your food then it must be the meal of the gods!"

Yukine and Daikoku stared weirdly at the man while Kofuku giggled. Xavier put his face in his palm as he groaned and Ren patted his back.

"N-no problem.", Yukine said

"Ne ne Daikoku how did you find him?", the goddess asked smiling up at her Shinki.

"I was coming back when I found him sobbing in an alleyway. When i approached him, he clung to me and begged for help to find his king.", the scruffy man said scratching his head.

"THANKS for that.", Xavier grumbled out as Larten had taken to now furiously polishing the king's shoes.

Everyone smiled at the antics before Yato asked. "So what's your story Larten?"

The butler quickly stood up and looked off with a blissful look. "I served my lord's previous incarnation, back in the glorious days of Romania. Dracula turned me into a vampire and made me his servent."

Gallons of tears seem to shoot from Larten's eyes. Kofuku and Daikoku actually started to worry about a flood!

"Then came the day...my lord Dracula perished to a vampire hunter!"

"Stop crying would you!", Xavier angrily ordered and immediately the tear falls stopped and Larten composed himself.

"Anyhow for hundreds of years I waited for a new master and when my lord was born I knew at first sight he was the reincarnation of Dracula!"

Larten launched himself at Xavier again only to stop as the king held him back from glomping him. Ren chuckled as he used his flames to head up his noodles. Everyone else took the situation and Hiyori awkwardly laughed.

"Well...at least he's dedicated."

What was next?
1553311111131.title: Larten The Loyal

choices: Yato, Yukine and Xavier Arrive on the Scene!
15533111111312.content:
The sun was setting, so Hiyori gathered up her things and began walking home.

The group sat in the living area of Daikoku and Kofuku's home.

"My lord we must talk...." Larten said, suddenly becoming very serious. Xavier looked up as his butler suddenly stopped scrambling to glomp him. "About...?" Xavier asked curiously.

"You've heard the rumors I'm sure...about a 'slasher' around these parts?" Larten asked, giving off a serious vibe.

"Yeah...so some psycho human decided to go on a rampage...what's that got to do with-" Xavier shrugged before blinking and noticing Larten was dangerously close to his face with that intimidating glare.

"My lord! Surely you must recognize the signs of a Vampaneze in the area!" Larten declared loudly.

"A what?" Daikoku asked gruffly.

Renard began to explain, "They're originally vampires who split from the main clans when vamps stopped killing humans they fed from. The Vampaneze are those who view humans as mere prey and livestock...so they drain or kill their victims indiscriminately. They usually appear as humanoids with purple-skin and blood red eyes and hair."

Yukine and Yato gained serious looks..though Yukine was unsettled by the mental image.

"Feh, I admit it occurred to me it might be one of them..but what do you want me to do about it?!" Xavier pouted at Larten.

"Put a stop to it!" Larten stated as if it was obvious.

"How would we know who the next victim is?! Or where he'll strike next-..." Xavier stopped and his eyes widened.

"What is it my lord?" Larten inquired. "Vampaneze usually mark their targets...with a small scratch mark. I...I noticed one on Hiyori..." Xavier said seriously.

~~~Meanwhile~~~

Hiyori hummed as she walked down the the deserted sidewalk to her house. She stopped when she caught an awful smell...like body odor mixed with garbage. "Ugh..what is tha-OH NO! I'M OUT OF MY BODY AGAIN!!" Hiyori panicked as she saw her tail and her body snoozing down the sidewalk.

A pair of red eyes gleamed in the darkness and a sinister giggle rang out. "W-who's there?!" Hiyori demanded, getting a bad feeling.

She received no answer...until a scary looking humanoid came out into the streetlight's glow. He had messy scarlet hair and beady red pupils in pitch black eyes. He was a large man and built like a gorilla...he had large sharp fangs that were shown as a grinned widely.

Most notable was that his skin was veiny and purple. "Poor sweet thing...this is no place for a nap." He said in a soft voice as he hunched over Hiyori's body.
15533111111312.title: Sunset and Vampaneze

choices: The group arrived to stop the Vampaneze
155331111113122.content:
"What do you mean Hayori's marked?", Yato said as his blue eyes darkened.

Xavier looked down as dread painted his face. "The Vampaneze can inflict marks on humans without touching them. They act as tracking beacons so that it won't be difficult to hunt them."

Yukine got up quickly. "We need to hurry then, Hayori could be in trouble right now!"

Everyone got up as well at the thought of the young girl being in danger. Xavier bit his lips as he clenched his eyes in distress.

"I'm worried, if your friend is drained then her being a Hanyou could result in her being turned into something horrible from the vampire venom."

"L-like what?", the blond boy asked in fear.

Xavier finally opened his eyes. "Since her spirit is still connected, the venom could react badly and she'll become....a zombie with no free will."

A heavy tension filled the air and Xavier hung his head. A firm hand on his shoulder made him look up to see Ren looking at him with a rare serious face.

"That's not gonna happen, she's got two fellows that care about her.", the foxboy smiled as he nodded to the God and Shinki who blushed and looked away.

"Young Ren is right my lord, and they will have us to assist them!", Larten exclaimed grasping Xavier and dragging him outside with everyone rushing out as well.

Yato and Yukine took the lead as they hurried down the route to Hayori's house.

Next...
155331111113122.title: A True Threat

1553311111131221.content:
Hiyori was currently chasing after the purple-skinned man who was currently carrying her body in his arms. "Hey you! Give my body back!" She yelled and tried to do one of her marital arts moves..only for it to have the predictable outcome of no effect.

"Oh yeah...I can't interact with people from the Near Shore when I'm a spirit." Hiyori sighed. Looking up she gasped as the purple-skinned man leaped into the air, soaring over buildings as he landed on a rooftop. "Hey come back heeeere!" Hiyori leaped into the air and ran up to the rooftop.

Murloch stood there above the city, Hiyori snoozing in his arms as he took in the night air. "What a lovely sight...the night air above a city...full of helpless rabbits. They rest easy...ignorant of the wolves that lurk in the shadows."

"Nice soliloquy...are you sure you should be so calm? Murloch?" A voice said from the shadows.

It was Nora, "Feh, what does a human brat like you know of me?" Murloch snapped.

"I don't...but I know that that girl you treat as a meal has quite powerful friends...just letting you know." Nora giggled, glancing over at Hiyori's spirit...but for some reason not letting Murloch know.

"Why is she protecting me...?" Hiyori thought.

"Hahahheehee! You expect me to be afraid of the brat king and his loyal pup? As well as that fool Larten? Be gone child, whatever you are I do not care..." Murloch caressed Hiyori's face in a creepy way.

"All I care is that I am soon to dine quite well." Murloch grinned toothily and leaped from the rooftop down towards an alley.

~With the others on the Search~

"Hiyoriii!" Yato and Yukine called out as they walked through the night.

The groups had split up into two teams: Yato, Yukine and Larten. And the second team consisted of Ren and Xavier. Larten had put up a fuss not being on Xavier's team...but Xavier insisted the two boys needed a vampire's sense of smell to track Hiyori and her stalker.

Somehow by this point Hiyori had gotten back into her body...and managed to scream in the vicinity of...
1553311111131221.title: Murloch the Vampaneze

choices: The fight turned in Larten's favor
The fight turned in Murloch's favor
15533111111312211.content:
The God, Shinki, and Vampire all sharply turned to the sudden scream.

"Hayori!", Yato cried called as he began to follow the source of the girl's voice with the rest of his group in tow.

Leaping up onto a roof, Yukine gasped as he saw a large purple beast about bite a awakened and struggling Hayori.

"OI UGLY!"

Murloch grunted as he turned towards the trio. As the Vampaneze's body shifted, Yato raised an eyebrow as he saw Nora standing on the rooftop over observing the scene. Deciding to deal with it later, the God rose a hand and prepared to call for Yukine but stopped as Larten stepped forward.

"Yato-sama I've dealt with this one before. Go make sure miss Hayori is ok.", the servent held a absolute look as he held the brim of his hat. Yato slowly nodded before he and Yukine rushed over to Hayori.

Murloch smirked as he saw the tall man approach his hulking form. "Ah the foolish servent. The world must be upside down, you aren't kissing the feet of your brat master right now!"

Larten tched as he shifted his stance. "If I remember I sent you cowering back to the dark last time we fought you vile creature."

Murloch growled as he rose his hands and brandished his claws. "Well this time I'll be sending you and that brat TO THE GRAVE!"

The Vampaneze charged and swiped at Larten, only to find him gone. The vampire came down from the sky, landing on Murloch's back and looped his legs around the brutes neck. As the purple giant thrashed around, the servent swiftly reached and pulled out two push knifes into his hands and stabbed into the thick skin of the dark vampire.

Murloch let out a feral growl as he threw Larten across the building only for him to flip and gain footing again. The Vampaneze growled and forced the two blades out of his back.

"IT'S GONNA TAKE A LOT MORE THEN THOSE PUNY TOYS!"

Larten held his composure before bringing up both of his hands with a knife in between each finger gap

"I have plenty of toys for you to pick out, clod."

Rushing at each other, Murloch threw his clawed hand at Larten only for him to dodge and have the claws penetrate the roof. The purple beast turned only to have a wave of knifes strick his arm and be kicked in the jaw by the servent. One of Murloch's teeth popped out and landed on the ground before being stomped by Larten.

"GRHHH you passive basterd, first you disturb my meal then you rob me of one of my beautiful teeth!"

Marloch began to rage and began to blindly punch and claw in every direction. Despite being pierced by Larten's knifes the Vampaneze didn't falter.

Soon....
15533111111312211.title: Servent V. Beast

155331111113122112.content:
Throwing the knives at Murloch, Larten's gasped as they were swatted away. The purple-beast in his rage seemed to be calling upon a lot of adrenaline fueled strength. Larten realized this was a fruitless battle...but he called over to Yato and Yukine who were helping Hiyori.

"Get her out of here-" Larten called, only to realize too late that Murloch was upon him. Murloch's black claws slashed through his flesh and blood spilled from his wounds.

Gripping Larten by the throat, Murloch hoisted him above his head before bringing him down forcefully against the ground.

"Where is that king of yours now?!?" Murloch hoisted Larten up again and slammed his head into the pavement.

"Call him!! Call for your precious little lord's help!!"

The others flinched as Larten was slammed into the ground again. "Has he abandoned you?! Left you to die?!"

Another slam and then Larten was lifted up...and Murloch sunk his fangs into the servant's shoulder...causing Larten to cry out in pain as blood squirted out.

Hiyori cried out and rushed forward, "HIYORI!" Yato and Yukine cried out in horror. Dropping Larten from his jaws, Murloch turned to Hiyori and opened his arms wide...as if to embrace her.

"The little lamb has come to the slaughter...." He grinned with a mouth dripping blood.

Hiyori was inches from being grabbed by Murloch....but two things happened at the same time.

Yukine formed a border between Murloch and Hiyori, gaining a frustrated growl from the Vampaneze.

Murloch clawed and pounded on the border, causing Yukine to grunt and strain to keep it up.

"Excuse me, we're not done here!" Larten's voice got Murloch's attention and as the beast turned around he got two push knives stabbed into his belly. "Gagh!" Murloch cried out as Larten swung him around and threw him out of the alley and into a lamp post across the street.

Larten grunted as he fell to the ground unconscious from his wounds and severe beating...he'd used up the last of his strength to get Murloch away.
155331111113122112.title: The Fight in Murloch's Favor

1553311111131221121.content:
( This is a collab chapter with me and CountDugula. His text will be RED and mine will be BLUE )

"Larten!" Hiyori cried out, Yukine couldn't keep the barrier up any longer and it vanished.
Murloch got to his feet and grinned, "End of the line...my little lambs."

A swirling of black and red energy crackled to life between Hiyori and the charging Vampaneze.

"Congratulations! You've thoroughly pissed me off!" Xavier's voice rang out...but it was tinged with a sort of demonic reverb. Yato got an intense feeling of darkness as the figure was revealed to be a tall man with ghost-white skin and long black hair. The figure wore black armor and a red cape that resembled wings. Renard rushed to Larten's side and hoisted him up.

The three looked in shock at the new arrival, he had Xavier's face and voice with a hard edge. His power flowed out in waves and flapped his hair and cape as he glared at Murloch with a wrathful look. Renard hurried over to them and slowly laid the heavily wounded vampire down.

"Is...he going to be ok?", Hiyori asked full of fear.

Ren shot her a reassuring smile before he began to fish around his pockets. "Don't worry vampires have a healing factor that let's them regenerate from wounds. But...with all the damage he's recieved he'll need a boost."

Everyone relaxed slightly at the foxboy's words. Yukine quirked an eyebrow as Ren brought out a vile of what seem to be blood. "What's that?"

Snapping the lit off, Ren opened Larten's mouth. "Some Xavier's blood, it can help speed up the healing factor and coming from the king of vampires should replenish Larten's stats."

With the liquid before poured into the servent's throat and unconsciously swallowed, a groan came from Larten. His shoulder wound began to close and reform lost tissue and the scratches on his face disappeared. Larten suddenly gasped as his eyes shot open.

Ren playfully nudged his shoulder. "Nice to see you up sleeping beauty."

Larten began to pat his face and body before a sparkling aura surrounded him. "Ah my lord's blood has saved me!", the servent then turned to Hiyori with tears forming. "Miss Hiyori your ok!"

Hiyori smiled but yelped as the vampire suddenly latched on and cried onto her. The Hanyou chuckled and awkwardly patted his back.

Yukine sweat dropped at the exchange, before turning to find Yato focused on Xavier and Murloch approaching the vampire king.
1553311111131221121.title: The Vampire King Arrives!

15533111111312211211.content:
"So his royal highness FINALLY graces us with his presence!" Murloch declared mockingly. Xavier was silent, simply glaring at the Vampaneze.

"You normally don't even bother with the likes of me...what changed? You know for a King who has consistently shirked his duties as Lord of the Vampires....you sure do-" Murloch taunted, yet still Xavier was silent.

Murloch tched, "Think you're too good to speak, cocky brat?!"

With a slash from his claws at the lamppost behind him, Murloch had made a jagged spear out of it.

"Hah! I'll make a bloody kebab of you!"

Xavier prepared himself, but Murloch was cunning...he leaped into the air over Xavier's head...heading towards...

"HIYORI!" Yukine yelled as the hanyou's body was about to be skewered.

"I HAVE NO INTEREST IN A DUEL WITH THE VAMPIRE KING!! I JUST WANT MY FOOD!!" Murloch shrieked insanely..until...

He fell to the ground with a thud before he could reach Hiyori, dropping his weapon to the street.

Blood poured from his mouth, "God....damn it....." Murloch's head rolled from his broad shoulders and onto the sidewalk...his corpse flopped over on its side.

"Cutting it close there ain't you?" Renard called over to the vampire king, who was already turning back into a young boy. "Oh shuddup!" Xavier snapped.
15533111111312211211.title: Murloch's Defeat

choices: Figuring out what to do with the ashes
155331111113122112111.content:
Yukine blinked in shock as the decapitation of Murloch and Xavier's re transformation set in. "W..what just happened?!"

Larten stopped glomping Hiyori as he gained a passionate eye. "That....was the power of the lord Vampire Dracula!"

Yato watched as Xavier calmly walked over from the dead Murloch. Such dark power was know calmed, Xavier was a wild card and probably hadn't even shown his full power.

Once Xavier reached Ren who still giggled at his statement, he tched and pointed at the purple corpse. "Hurry up and go torch the remains."

Ren stood up and gave a mock two finger salute. "Yes your majesty~", before walking over to Murloch and his head. The Totem took a deep breath and rubbed his hands together before releasing a large stream of blue fire. Everyone watched as the blue flames covered Murloch's corpse and within a few seconds reduced the large body to ash.

"Larten, go collect the ashes.", Xavier ordered.

The servent now fully healed sprang up and gave a quick bow and "Yes my lord!" before rushing over and started scooping the ashes into a metal box.

"Why are you taking his ashes?", Hiyori asked worried.

"Just to be safe. A Vampire or Vampaneze can be resurrected if their remains are submerged in blood for a year, or worse their brought back by a dark spell. The first thing this basterd's pals would do is try and revive thier best fighter."

Larten cleaned his hands with a handkerchief after the ash was placed in the box. The servent presented the box to Xavier who nodded in appreciation, Ren walked back with his hands behind his head as he sighed

What was next?
155331111113122112111.title: Ashes To Death

1553311111131221121111.content:
Xavier and Ren departed with the ashes, of course they were followed closely by Larten. Yukine and Yato took Hiyori home and soon were back at Daikoku's place.

"Oh you're back, how'd it go?" Kofuku cheerfully asked them. "Alright I guess...this vampire stuff is a lot to take in. But at least Xavier is on our side...I think." Yukine said as he flopped down to the floor.

"I did some digging while you were gone. I found out a lot about Xavier's so called ancestor." Daikoku stated seriously.

"Really? I mean I know the basics, but I was always in Japan...I never really bothered going outside the country during the centuries." Yato admitted.

"Not like you have the cash to travel..." Yukine murmured.

"Anyway! His name was Vlad III, but folks called him Vlad the Impaler for obvious reasons. He was a hero during the Crusades and was chosen to lead armies into battle with the blessing of the Church." Daikoku explained.

"Go on..." Yato said, a serious look in his eyes.

"As far as the vampire stuff, the legend goes that he fell in love and was due to marry a young woman named Mina. But a Turkish arrow delivered false reports of Vlad's death. So she threw herself from the highest tower in despair."

"He was called back and the priests then told him that his beloved's soul was damned because of her suicide. From what I gather he flew into a rage and slaughtered them all...cursing God for what he saw as a betrayal after he'd protected his church. Supposedly he gave his soul over to darkness and swore to arise from his own death again and again to feed on the blood of God's children."
1553311111131221121111.title: Rest and Stories

15533111111312211211111.content:
Yato and Yukine were silent as they heard the tale of Dracula. From what Xavier said and the power displayed, they believed Dracula was nothing but a demonic beast who showed no mercy. The truth was that Dracula was driven to Darkness from losing the one he loved.

Yukine sat up and looked off. "I didn't know that's how Dracula was born."

Yato sighed as he sat down next to his Shinki. "People are driven to do dark things when bad omans come."

Daikoku rubbed his scruffy chin. "After he slaughtered a large portion of the Ottoman army and turned his subjects into vampires, Dracula was finally killed by his son who staked him and burned his remains. His ashes were stolen by his worshippers and a spell was casted to ensure that thier lord would be reborn."

"Then he was reborn as Xavier right?", Yukine asked.

Kofuku shook her head. "Nope! Turns out Mr.Fangs has been spreading terror for the past 300 years."

"HUH?!"

"Before Xavier, Dracula was reborn in 1560 as the Hungarian countess Elizabeth Bathory. She sought to become more powerful by killing and bathing in the blood of up to 600 young women. However, after being discovered she was trapped in her room and eventually died from not feeding."

"Then he-she was reborn as Xavier?", Yato asked leaning forward.

Daikoku shook his head. "No, I'll explain the others another time but the last incarnation of Dracula was the murderer Richard Chase, who drank the blood of his victims."

The God and Shinki were tensed up as the terror of Dracula was stretched out throughout history. Xavier seemed like a regular teen, but the power and dark history must have a sort factor in his life.
15533111111312211211111.title: History of Dracula

1553331.content:
It was a bright and peaceful day in the town of Magnolia. The sky was clear and the citizens enjoyed a nice day of shopping, traveling, and-

CRASH

...that.

While Magnolia town was calm, the same couldn't be said about the prominent guild Fairy Tail. As while a quiet day suited others fine, the family of Fairy Tail preferred more ....chaotic mornings.

"Oi ice stripper what was that for?!"

"It was your fault the pay was deducted flame head!"

In the guild hall as per tradition, the mages Natsu Dragneel and Gray Fullbuster were butting heads. Fire and ice pressed together as the two faced off. The cause was a matter of the reward for a mission being lessened due to some complications completing the task.

"Both of you cut it out!", a firm and feminine voice ordered.

Both Natsu and Gray stiffed as they turned and quickly nodded. Their guild member Erza Scarlet watched humming as the formerly clashing rivals were now acting buddy buddy.

"None of you two are at fault for the reduction. The map we were given from the guard was outdated and failed to include the new trails crafted in the forest."

Both wizards nodded quickly, not wanting to agitate their guild mate. Although as soon as Erza turned a spark of clashing flew between Natsu and Gray.

Lucy sighed as she leaned on the bar counter. "Honestly can't those two ever take a break?" The blond's eyes suddenly blinked as she looked around the guild hall.

"Ne Natsu, where's Happy? He's been gone since we got back."

Natsu snapped out of the stare as he hummed and turned towards Lucy. "Hmm, he said he wanted to check out the new import of fish. He has been gone pretty long though..."

The doors to the guild suddenly opened, the exceed in question came flying in. Happy smiled as he waved his paw in a welcoming gesture. "Ne ne in here!"

Natsu raised an eyebrow at his cat friend. "Eh Happy what's up the fish that good?"

"Yeah it was! But everyone I got someone who may want to join!"

That got the guild chatting as they saw a figure walking in from the bright outside. Confusion struck everyone as the outline of this stranger didn't seem completely human. Surprise soon echoed as the doors cleared and the stranger was revealed.

( https://www.deviantart.com/fudge1999/art... )

The young man had longish blond hair, accompanying them was a pair of light orange fox ears. From the back of the red kimono, nine fox tails lightly swished.

The red eyes held a friendly grin as he walked up behind Happy. "Ah you were right Happy, this guild hall is rather nice"

Happy grinned as he floated and placed a paw on the man's fluffy ear. "Nyeh I told you! Everyone this is Mitsue, he wants to join!"

Mitsue chuckled as he flapped his ears. "I said my answer was undecided, I still need to think things over."

"Hey you should join, if Happy wants you to join then that must mean your cool!", Natsu grinned walking up to the foxman.

Mitsue smiled at the words before Erza placed a had on her chin. "How exactly did you meet Happy?"

The newcomer hummed as he looked to Happy. "I believe you should tell them, in the meantime would you mind if I had a drink."

Erza nodded and gestured to the bar, gaining a small smile as Lucy looked at the numerous tails in awe as Mitsue sat down.

Happy cleared his throat as he took a nice fish out of his green knapsack. "Hm well I had just got the perfect fish when...."

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Happy happily hummed as he carried the fresh fish back to the guild. He wanted to gobble it up now but reminded himself that this fish was quite rare.

Unfortunately, the trip back had a delay as one of the fish fell out of his knapsack and flopped into a alley.

"Nyeh! No come back!"

However upon flying into the ally, Happy found himself being pressed against a wall. The cause being three hoodlums all looking at him with devious faces.

"An exceed eh, but you make some good jewels!"

Happy struggled against the hand and attempted to use his Aera. Finding he couldn't fly away from the three.

Before he could be ensnared, Happy and the others heard a clanking sound coming from deep within the alley. Approaching them was a figure, a unsettling feature were the beady red eyes glowing in the dark not blinking as he only produced the clanking sound of his wooden sandals.

"O-oi don't just stand there gut him!", the one holding Happy barked out.

Quickly charging the figure, the goon took out a dagger and with a yell raised it to strike the figure. Within a second, the figure slammed the goon into the alley wall with a backhand slap.

The show of strength and unblinking red orbs installed more fear in the hoodlums. With one more steps the three fled the alleyway, trying to outrun the terror.

Happy let out a breath as he finally could freely fly again. The feeling of anxiousness left Happy as the red orbs finally revealed a concerned face.

"Are you alright, they didn't harm you?"

The exceed couldn't answer as he gawked, suddenly seeing the ears and tails of the stranger.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

"Mitsue helped me and he isn't going anywhere so I asked him to join!", Happy exclaimed taking a bite of his fish.
1553331.title: Fairy Tail

15533311.content:
"That's some story..." Lucy admitted as she took a sip of juice. Erza nodded, "Well looks like we owe you a debt for saving Happy."

Mitsue smiled sheepishly, "Aww, it was nothing."

"Well you're welcome to join our guild if you wish!" Makarov said before hopping up into sight on the bar. "Master! When did you get back?!" Erza asked in surprise.

"Just in time to hear how our new friend saved Happy." Makarov smiled. "Yeah! Thanks for saving my little buddy!" Natsu cheerfully whacked Mitsue on the back.

"Like I said, I was just passing by and he seemed in trouble." Mitsue smiled slightly.

"Quite a coincidence we have two foxes wishing to join today." Makarov closed his eyes in thought.

"Huh? Two?" Mitsue's ears flicked in curiosity. "Ah yes, well...the little fellow is under the bar right now...it's been a long journey for him.

"Huh?" Everyone peeked over the bar to see an exceptionally fluffy and adorable looking fox...fast asleep.

"Wow! A real fox! Is he going to be our mascot?" Natsu cheered.

"HEEY! I thought I was the mascot!!" Happy pouted.

"How's a fox going to be a member? No offense, Mitsue." Elfman said to the foxboy.

"None taken." Mitsue sweatdropped.

"Settle down. He's not JUST some wild fox. During my travels through the wilderness, this fellow kept following me. He was hungry and alone...and appeared confused. I gave him some food and something to drink, and then he revealed himself to me." Makarov explained mystically.

Everyone looked rather confused as an awkward silence fell over everyone. "I SAID: He revealed himself to me!" Makarov whacked the fox on the noggin. "Owww! Jeez!" The fox yelped.

Everyone's eyes widened not only at the fox apparently talking...but in a flash of light the fox morphed into a young man with fox ears and a single fluffy fox tail sticking out the back of his pants.
15533311.title: A Second Fox!?

155333111.content:
"Oi what was that for?!", the foxboy huffed rubbing his head, fluffy tail standing up.

Makarov crossed his arms. "You missed your cue! Honestly how can anyone sleep for that long?" Looking over the guild master's point was proven as the young man was laying on the bar counter close to dozing off.

"Seriously?!", with another whack the foxboy had two bumps on his head as he groaned and hopped down from the bar.

"Alright alright! The names Renard but I prefer Ren. Makarov here lend me a hand, didn't really have anywhere to go and he said I might have a place here.", Ren put his hands behind his head as he took a seat.

Natsu looked between Ren and Mitsue, soon widening his eyes. "Oh, ne are you two related!?"

Ren raised an eyebrow as he turned to where the pinkette was looking. His eyes widened as he saw the kimono wearing Mitsue, looking at him in awe. Walking up, Ren observed the other foxboy, taking in every detail.

Mitsue suddenly sweatdropped as Ren reached forward and lightly squeezed his ears. Humming Ren suddenly smiled. "Yep their real."

"He was concerned about the ears?!, everyone thought as Ren took to observing Mitsue's tails.

Makarov took a sip of a offered drink, courtesy of Mira. "It be difficult for them to be siblings Natsu. Whatever being Mitsue is I doubt he is that of a totem."

Erza looked in slight awe as she looked to Ren. "A totem, I thought they were mere legends."

This got the guild chatting as they discussed the presence of a mythical figure among them. Lucy hummed as Ren was resting his head against Mitsue's numerous tails, the kimono man grinning as he drank his sake.

"What exactly is a totem Ren?"

Ren opened an eye. "I basically helped groups of people find their way and give protection. As long as they feed me I'll help them."

"Thats....honorable.", Lucy sweatdropped.
155333111.title: Ren The Fox Totem

1553331111.content:
Afterwards, Mitsue and Ren got their guild marks from Mirajane. Mitsue got his on his right shoulder, since the opposite was taken up by another tattoo. Renard got his right on the palm of his right hand.

"ALRIGHT! Let's party! To welcome our new guild mates!" Natsu roared as the entire guild hall cheered. Pretty soon everyone was having a good time, drinking frothy beers as Mirajane walked through with a tray of food and drinks.

Ren was sipping some sort of fruit-flavored alcohol. Mitsue raised an eyebrow, "You sure you're old enough?" he asked as he sipped his sake.

"I actually bet I'm older than you, junior." Ren smirked.

"You're on. At the count of three we say our age." Mitsue smirked back.

3...
2...
1.....

"500!"

"2,000!"

Mitsue blinked and Ren grinned triumphantly, "Haha! Come back in a few thousand years, kiddo!" Ren ruffled Mitsue's hair. Mitsue growled a bit but just ordered more sake.

Team Natsu blinked and yelped out: "YOU'RE TWO-THOUSAND YEARS OLD?! YOU'RE 500!?"
1553331111.title: Two Foxy Fairy Newbies

15533311111.content:
Despite the shocked face Natsu was giving them, both foxes raised an eyebrow amused at the surprised.

"Yeah, not sure how long but us totems stay kicking for a while.", Ren stretched as he took another swing. "What about you Mitsu-Mitsu how are you not rocking wrinkles?"

The blond man hummed as he paused in sipping his sake. "Well...its a long story. Short answer is, I'm not exactly human anymore..."

Mitsue's tone and eyes seem to gain a melancholy tinge as he looked down at the bar counter. He blinked as his cup was refilled, Mira smiled as she slid his cup closer.

"Hey cheer up, now's not the time to feel down! People join our guild as we all faced hardships, were all like a family, now you and Ren are too."

Mitsue blinked, taking in the words. All the years he spent wandering, meeting amazing people only to watch them grow and peacefully pass. Yet again he seem to find an amazing family. Ren smiled and hummed, remembering times of peace and protecting the ones he cared about. The two foxes soon felt Natsu wrap an arm around each of their shoulders.

"Hell yeah that's right, being here means your part our family! So perk up this is a celebration after all!", the pinkette grinned.

The kimono foxboy soon grew a toothy grin as he quickly downed his sake. "Your right, no more moping!"

Ren quickly chugged his fruity drink before letting out a breath and chuckle. "Got that right junior!"

Mitsue gained a tick mark on his head, Mirajane giggled as she refilled the cup only for it needing to be filled again a second later.

"Oi I dispatched a group of knights in 5 seconds!"

Ren soon needed a refill as well. "Huh really? I took down a Wyvern in that time!"

Mitsue took another swing, slamming the cup down. "I built a couple a minka in a day!"

Ren narrowed his eyes. "Well I did the same but I made sure they had tatami and a well!"

The two foxes were beginning to slur their words, they may be hundreds of years old but the alcohol was still alcohol.

Ren suddenly engulfed his fists in blue flames. "Since ya so tuff junior why not indul...hugh!ge me?!"

Mitsue stumbled as his tails suddenly spread out, a kanji symbol appearing before each of them. "May..be I will!"

The guild looked in both confusion and awe as the two foxes drunkenly took stances. In slow motion, the two jumped at each other making battle cries.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

🎵"Yai yai asobi ni yukou ka
Yai yai warae ya warae
Rai rai musunde hiraite
Rai rai rasetsu to mukuro!"🎵

Rather then duking out in a chaotic battle, Ren and Mitsue were sitting on the floor. Goofily grinning as they wrapped an arm around eachother's shoulder and swayed side to side. Drunkly singing a song Mitsue learned on one of his travels.

"Ah it seems they've calmed down.", Erza calmly observed.

"They calmed down pretty quick.", Lucy sweatdropped.

While the guild was watching the two drunk foxes happily jeering, Natsu pouted and crossed his arms.

"Hmph, I wanted to see how they fight!"
15533311111.title: A Fox Celebration

155333111111.content:
Time passed and soon Mitsue and Renard were fitting right in as members of the Fairy Tail family. When time came for Lucy to pay her rent, she was of course recruiting Team Natsu to do jobs with her. Ren's ears twitched as he overheard the conversation in front of the Job Board on the wall.

"Huh? What's going on?" Renard stood up from a table and wandered over. Mitsue strode over as well. "Ah, hey guys! Would you like to join us on a quest to help me pay my rent?" Lucy asked sweetly.

"You sure are laying it on thick." Happy snarked, getting a glare from the blond girl. "Am not, pussycat!"

"Sure, we need to get our feet wet and show what we can do." Mitsue smiled toothily. "Alriight! I finally get to see you two fight!" Natsu cheered excitedly.

Erza and Gray just sighed, "This isn't playtime, flame-head."

"What'd you say?! Ice breath!?" Natsu and Gray butted heads...until of course Erza separated them. "What job did you have in mind?"

Lucy's eyes turned to dollar signs as she held up the flyer, "This one!"

Everyone's jaws dropped, it was an outrageous reward....just for taking care of a dark guild who was terrorizing a village!

"That can't be right...maybe it's a mistake." Gray said thoughtfully.

"Perhaps it's a wealthy patron who is desperate..." Erza placed a hand to her chin in thought.

"More like sucker! This'll be a piece of cake...and I'll be riich!"

Upon getting stern looks from the others, Lucy corrected herself. "I-I mean WE! We'll be rich! I'll just have enough to pay my rent for a long time!" Lucy laughed nervously.

Meanwhile, at that very same village...it was a massacre. The job request was fake alright, but the village was in danger...or rather danger had already arrived.

A villager lay under the rubble of their house, a shadow falling over them. "P-please...why have you done this?! What did we do to you?!" He asked a shirtless and heavily tattooed man with a braided beard.

"Have to make it seem authentic, get their blood boiling upon seeing what this 'dark guild' has done." The mysterious figure stated casually.

"B-but what dark guild do you belong to?!" The village wheezed as he was hoisted up by the neck.

"I don't...that's the point." The figure responded coldly before choking the life out of the poor innocent.
155333111111.title: Job Request...or Is It?

1553331111111.content:
After some time to prepare for departure, the guild members were to meet in order to take a train. Natsu of course against this but alas the village in question was quite far.

"Ugh can't we just walk there?!", Natsu huffed looking at the train awaiting boarding.

"The village in need of aid is a good distance past Mt. Hakobe, traveling by foot will take too long.", Erza explained putting her heavy bags down.

Lucy hummed as she looked at everyone. Erza was looking the other way checking her luggage so that gave the two elemental rivals a chance to but heads after Gray made a remark about the train and Natsu.

The train's whistle alerted everyone, the train was leaving soon yet the two foxes of Fairy Tail had yet to arrive. Lucy nervously looked at everyone else boarding. "Oh what's holding up Ren and Mitsue?"

"Sorry for the delay!", a apologetic voice yelled.

Mitsue came running up, fast clanks from his shoes as he let out a breath while stopping in front of the group. Everyone looked in confusion as on one arm the blond had a small brown bag, while in in the crook of his other arm was Ren in his fox form.

"Yo.", Ren lifted a paw in greeting before closing his eyes and relaxing.

Gray raised in eyebrow. "Why is he in that form, were about to leave."

Mitsue sweatdropped. "Well.....

"Ne Ren hurry we have to get to the trai....what are you doing?"

Mitsue had stopped by the guild to walk with Ren and was greeted the ginger in fox form. The fox jumped into his arms and yawned.

"Well Mitsue you see... I don't really have that many jewels and boarding will probably think of me as your pet-"

"You just don't wanna walk do you?", Mitsue narrowed his eyes and flicked his ears.

"........Ok yeah."

The blond boy sighed before beginning to jog. "Fine, let's go."

Mitsue felt up Ren by the scruff. "So that's about it." Ren looked up with a pout on his snout. "Hey junior come on I don't weigh that much."

A tick mark grew as Mitsue pushed him into Lucy's arms. Yelping, the celestial wizard adjusted the fluffy creature before giggling and his soft fur. Ren meanwhile had a small blush as his head was resting on a....pillowy area.

"Now that we're all here let's set off!", Erza called as she and the others began to board, all while Natsu cringed at the stomach irking ride.

Soon the train departed and the Fairy Tail members were on the way to their supposed mission. Natsu layed on the seat, knocked out curtsey of Erza so he wouldn't be suffering from the dragon slayer weakness. The scarlet haired swords women sat looking closely at the location given of the village all while Happy relaxed and ate some snacks.

The seats ahead were filled by Lucy, Gray, and the two foxboys. Ren snoozed on Lucy's lap while she stroked his back humming.

Gray hummed as he leaned back and crossed his arms. "Ne Mitsue, I don't wanna seem pushy asking this but if Ren's a totem...then what are you?"

Mitsue looked at the ice mage, the two intensely looked at each other as a aura of tension seem to form. Finally Mitsue looked away with a flustered face.

"Um...what happened to your shirt Gray?"

The ice age looked down in shock as an article of his clothes had vanished. "Damn not again!"

Mitsue chuckled as the air became cheerful and warm. "I believe I should tell you, wouldn't want to remain a enigma."

The blond boy closed his eyes and hummed. "I suppose in order to tell you about what I am I must first tell you about the origins of my family."

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
"This tale of my family is said to be one of truth, a common saying in my family is that we were a clan of kitsune. It was said centuries before I was born a marriage occured between my ancestor Tsunayashi and the fox spirit who guided him named Akari."

A man emerged from the dense woods, looking worn as he stumbled from his trek. Besides him emerged a large glowing fox, a red and white scarf adorning its neck. Tsunayashi fell to his knees breathing relieved as his trek to reach the land away from the group of dark wizards who attacked his village while preaching of their dark lord.

A soft bump came from the mystical creature, it had aided him by showing Tsunayashi the way to safety and protecting him. The man smiled warmly as he stroked the kitsune's head. "Thank you."

The creature hummed before suddenly glowing and shifting it's shape. The light soon died down and it's place was a beautiful woman with long platinum hair flowing around her ears and tails, the red eyes of the kitsune woman slowly looked at Tsunayashi before she smiled at him.

Taking the hands of Tsunayashi, Akari helped him up before both of them looked into each others eyes warmly.

"They were soon bounded in love and gave birth to the clan of Fudo. While descendants did inherit her hair, they didn't possessthe other kistune features. I was the first one to grow the ears and tails hehe."
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Lucy listen in awe at the story as Gray had a look of thought. Ren blinked as he heard the story, thinking over everything.

"Wait, how come you were the first to pop the fluffy features?", Ren asked as he morphed into his human form and took a seat.

Mitsue looked off a tad nervous. "Well that-."

The kitsune stopped his sentence as the train whistle sounded, signaling their arrival. Quickly, Mitsue stood up and held a shaky grin. "I can tell you all another time, but for now let's go!"

The wizards looked confused at the kitsune's sudden attitude, Ren sighed before shifting back into his fox form and hopping into Mitsue's arms.
1553331111111.title: The Tale Of The Kitsune

15533311111111.content:
Once they departed the train station, they made their way to their destination. Natsu groaned as his stomach finally settled down. "Jeez, how far is this dumb place?!" He complained.

"Oh good, the Flame-Head finally is at himself again..." Gray commented. "YOU WANNA GO, SNOWMAN!?" Natsu roared as the two butted heads...until they all noticed smoke billowing over the hills.

"Ughgh! What's that smell?!" Natsu covered his nose and mouth with both hands. "Whatever it is, it stinks..." Lucy coughed.

"Where was this village supposed to be?" Happy asked worriedly. There was a pause, before Erza's eyes widened, "Everyone! Hurry!" She raced off towards the smoke.

"Erza! Wait!" Lucy called before they all raced after the S-Class mage.

They followed Erza until they were within the boundaries of a ransacked village. The huts were demolished and most had been torn apart and used as kindling on a massive fire. Most horrific of all was that the smoke billowing from the fire...was from a stack of the burning corpses of the villagers.

"W-what happened here...?" Lucy whimpered.

Renard and Mitsue's ears twitched, the foxboys had a bad feeling about this.

"Ah! Was wondering when you'd show up!" A jovial voice said, coming from a man seated beside the flames. He was casually roasting the leg of some beast he'd killed, over the grotesque pyre.

He stood up, the meat half cooked...but to their disgust he tore off a chunk with his teeth, blood dripping down his chin into his braided beard.

"Gross!" Happy and Lucy cried out together. Erza grabbed the hilt of her sword. "Who are you?! Are you the one who did this?!"

The man stepped forward, tossing the meat hunk over his shoulder. They saw he was shirtless and his entire torso was covered in rune-like tattoos. "And what if I am? If you don't like my answer what are you going to do about it?!" In a blur of motion, the man's words were uttered through laughter...as he was in front of Gray in an instant.

The man's elbow struck Gray in the solar plexus, sending him flying backwards through a tree. "So fast!" Erza gasped.

Ren's eyes were wide with horror, this guy...he seemed familiar.

Natsu engulfed his fists and struck the man in the jaw, the stranger hit the ground. "Hmph! You ain't so tough!" Natsu snapped.

The stranger turned to Natsu as he began to stand up, to their surprise the scorch mark on his cheek was healing itself. "Y'know, my dead grandmother can hit harder than that...so I wouldn't be acting so cocky!" The man was gone and reappeared behind Natsu.

"NATSU LOOK OUT!" Lucy, Happy and the two foxboys yelled out. Blocking a flaming elbow to the face, the stranger smirked. "You know, this was a trap. You walked right into it and sprang it better than I could've ever hoped!!" Natsu got a chop to the ribs, causing him to gasp out before he was kicked away.

"You should consider yourselves lucky, the All-Father doesn't just deem any old losers a threat...but once he does, he wants your petals plucked."

"What are you talking about?!" Erza demanded.

The villain chuckled as Mitsue went to attack, which was dodged with that unfathomable speed. "As I said before, you lot are getting a bit too big for your britches. So you need to be erased. Nothing personal. However, there is one selfish reason I took this errand."

Mitsue brandished his Wakizashi, to his surprise, the stranger gripped the blade and sliced his hand down it. Blood seeped onto the ground and down the man's arm...but he seemed unfazed.

"I think I'm gonna hurl..." Happy had turned green.

"You see," The wound healed as the man laughed insanely, "I CAN'T FEEL ANY OF THIS!"

The man delivered a palm strike to Mitsue's face as it finally clicked in Ren's head who this man was.

"Baldor...." Ren gasped quietly.
15533311111111.title: A New Threat: Baldor

155333111111111.content:
"Ren...come to me."

A elderly man in robes sat before a large burning fire, the atmosphere of the night was silent safe for the crinkling of the embers flicking off of the flames. Soon the sound of soft footsteps rang out and from the rustling bushes emerged a fox, soon glowing and shifting into Ren. The orange haired boy wore a green loincloth and a beaded necklace with a feather.

Kneeling down Ren looked curiously at the man. "Why are you awake Elder? Everyone else went to sleep already.

Humming the elderly man waved his hand over the fire, giving an intense look. "I witnessed a...rather distributing vision today, I fear that my clan will face a terrifying threat soon."

Ren gained a troubled look. "Why would someone want to attack, I thought when word spread that you had a totem on your side that be a clear no go not to threaten your clan.

"I'm not sure Ren, all I saw was my people being slain, crying out in terror and pain! A single name was being uttered in my vision."

"What was it?"

".....Baldor."

"HAH!"

Numerous swords flew through the air, however with each strike made to the ground their target appeared a few feet away. Erza launched forward towards Baldor, despite the swift slashes the swordswoman wasn't able to make a hit on her opponent as he disappeared from each blow.

A slash soon mained Baldor's chest however just as before the wound soon closed up. The runed man scoffed as he striked Erza in the stomach and sent her flying back.

"I was expecting more, yet this is all you give me!"

Erza used her sword to push herself up, clenching her teeth as she looked to Baldor. "He moves fast and any wound I manage to inflict dosen't do anything! Just who is he...

Mitsue growled as he flared his tails out a symbol soon appeared on one marked 火災, the blade of his wakizashi glowed as he rose it.

"Kagutsuchi!", with a slash of his blade a wave of fire launched at Baldor. The man was launched forward and had a back of seared flesh, how ever Baldor just sighed as stood up and his flesh once again closes up.

The blond boy soon widened his eyes as Baldor appeared before him. Mitsue rose his blade and striked only for Baldor to hold the blade again drawing blood. The kitsune soon cried out as he was thrown back into a tree.

"Erza, Mitsue!", Lucy cried out in panic.

"Nyeh this is bad, he's really strong!", Happy shook his head distressed.

Erza stood up and rose her sword. "Even if he is strong...what he's done is unforgivable!"

"Erza."

Looking over, the redhead looked in confusion as Ren stepped forward, a shadow covering his eyes. "I know this sounds crazy but I'm gonna go in."

"Ren what are you talking about? You've seen how strong he is we can't attack him alone!"

Ren looked up his lazy face holding a glare. "I know hes strong, I've encountered this strength before. But i have unfinished buisness with him....

A sudden burst of blue fire enveloped Ren, spreading out around him. Holding out his hand a stream of blue fire soon molded into that of an ax with a large blade. A sword soon appeared in his other hand.

"...and so does my clan."

"Huh those flames, something about you rings a bell.", Baldor narrowed his eyes as he saw Ren walking up.

"I'll help you remember!", Ren growled as he twirled his axe.
155333111111111.title: Familiar Opponents

choices: Maou and Urushihara ask the Obvious Question: "Who are you, really?"
15533331.content:
Sadao Maou had the day off one Saturday, as usual things were quiet around the Villa Rosa Sasazuka.

Lucifer at his computer, Ashiya at the kitchen sink and Maou seated at the middle table all looked up at the same moment. The trio of male demons sensed it, a magical presence that was not human but not demon either.

A car pulled up into the parking lot of the apartments, the driver was the source of the magical energy they were feeling.

Maou came over to the window by Lucifer's area and peered out to see a boy with reddish orange hair talking to the landlady Mi Kitty. He popped the trunk and two movers (obviously hired by the landlady) began to unload boxes and bring them up the stairs.

"He doesn't look like a threat..." Maou commented. "Appearances can be deceiving, sire." Ashiya countered as the movers were now in the hallway following the landlady to the previously unowned room across from Maou's and his two former demon generals.

Even more odd, was that the person had driven up with a car. Making Lucifer shift his gaze away from the screen of his Laptop, over to near the window. Who did they know that had a car, that would drive here? No one. Right? Or at least, no one to their knowledge yet... When Maou came over, near his spot, to peer out the window, Lucifer didn't bother to at first. Boss had it.

Although, upon hearing the comment's between Maou and Ashiya's comment's, Lucifer's purple orb's finally drifted enough to gaze out the window.

It was then, he could see what they were talking about. Some man, with Reddish orange hair.

"That guy definitely isn't all human. And wait...what's that other presence I'm sensing?" Ashiya came over as well, and sure enough the men rolled out a rather long black crate that one would swear resembled a coffin.

"Jeez, don't tell me we're getting vampires." Maou said half joking.

As things quieted down and the ginger haired man's luggage and furniture was moved up into one of the other one room apartments, the trio of demons started to calm down a bit.

That was when the doorbell rang for the Maou household. "Hello! It's your new neighbor!" A cheerful, young voice declared from the other side of the door.

Ashiya stood up and opened the door to reveal the man they'd seen earlier and just been discussing standing there with a bright smile. "Oh hello! My name is Richard Morrigan! I've just moved to Japan from America, a pleasure to meet you."

Even just standing in front of the guy, Ashiya could tell this was no ordinary person...the amount of magic he was exuding was more than any of them had managed to conjure up this whole time!

It was almost like an overflowing well of power.

"The pleasure is mine, I am Shiro Ashiya." Ashiya bowed politely.

He would notice that the man was carrying a small cardboard box. "Oh, the landlady told me it is Japanese custom to give gifts to new neighbors. I wanted them to be unique to each individual so I inquired to her what your preferences were."

"Of course, come right in!" Ashiya stood out of the way and Richard took notice of the shoes in front of the door, slipping his slip-on sneakers off as that Japanese custom he'd heard about was now confirmed.

"This is our new neighbor Richard Morgan." Ashiya introduced the ginger haired boy to the room...jumping a bit when the boy excitedly waved a big book of coupons in his face. "Here ya go!"

Upon realizing what it was, Ashiya proceeded to embrace Richard and start bawling: "Truly you are a WONDERFUL neighbor to consider our grocery expenses!!"

Almost immediately after, Ashiya bowed quickly to Sadao and proclaimed he was going out shopping...and was running down the street shortly after.

Maou on the other hand causally took the movie. Not knowing what it was right away, he scanned over it. "Thanks! This will be good if we ever have a movie night or something like that!." If one could ever get the entire gang up for it. And a certain one away from the laptop of his. Still, Satan himself was thankful for this gift.

Lucifer glossed over the PC game. Eager to be able to play it later today. By far, this had to be the best gift given. "Thanks, I've been wanting to play this one, actually. Guess I got lucky, huh?" He mumbled a little. The purple haired NEET looked up to the man. "You said your name is Richard, right?" He asked, to make sure.

He kind of didn't care, but, one should at least know the other person's name. "So, you're staying in the place next door?" Normally he didn't exactly care too much to strike up a conversation with many others... But he'd be lying if he said the amount of power coming from Richard wasn't intriguing.

Richard nodded, "Yeah, I am! Me and my roommate actually. He's uh...asleep...he works nights." Richard said with a sheepish chuckle.
15533331.title: Devil is a Part Timer!

155333311.content:
While the orange haired stranger did give off a chipper and happy vibe, the power emitting from him held a lot more to his character. Lucifer glanced at Maou before sighing and putting his chin in his palm.

"Alright your a pretty cool neighbor so far, but who are you really?"

Richard blinked confused at the question, Maou crossed his arms as he looked over the seemingly human person. "If your attempting to hide your magic, then your doing a poor job at it."

The orange haired male blinked once more before sighing, after clearing his throat Richard's voice now had a more tired tinge as his eyes dropped as well. "Well this happened quicker then planned. Guess the gig is up."

Shaking his head, thd strands of hair on Richard's head began to fluff up soon having two big fox ears grow, giving his hips a little swing a big poofy tail popped out as well. The foxboy hummed flicking his ears. "I use Richard as a human name, the real name is Renard."

The demon lord and fallen angel stared in surprise at the site, such power and form must mean this individual is from Ente Isla. But out of the numerous races, a humanoid with fox features wasn't one seen before.

"You..are you from Ente Isla as well?", Maou firmly asked on guard should Ren try anything. Lucifer stood up watching closely.

Ren chuckled, throwing his arms behind his head. "Relax there mighty lord, i actually live here. I just use Richard when dealing with regular life crap, I'm not gonna try and usurp you or any crap. I'm here to help you."

This got the two confused. "Huh, how the hell are you gonna help fox head?", Lucifer asked raising an eyebrow.

Ren hummed suddenly extending a finger, a small blue flame sprouted from the tip. "Unlike your world me and some other paranormal buddies found out how to harness magic without making humans miserable."

Maou felt his eyes widened, a way to gain energy with the negative energy of humans, such a thing was possible? A way for his kind to survive that doesn't involve the suffering of others?

The foxboy clicked his tongue as he started exiting the room. "I'll be back in a second i have someone else to join my TED talk!"

Lucifer grunted in confusion as he thought over the Fox's words. Clearly this couldn't be true, the negativity of others was the only way he and other dark beings could become stronger.

Ren soon came back in, carrying the coffin from earier in one hand. Standing it up, Ren sighed rubbing his chin. Suddenly the foxboy took a large bite out of his palm, Mauo and Lucifer were surprised by the sudden act of harm. Waving his arm in front of the coffin, it began to shake soon the door to the coffin opened.

The door soon creaked open reveling a black haired pale boy with bat pajamas

15533333.content: Both supernatural, vaaarrry different in genres...

info.brief_description: Your own OCs get to have adventures in an anime of your choosing!
info.description:
This interactive was created due to the various original ideas I wished to have written out and shared with others...one in particular involves the anime/manga Black Butler but that will be it's own branching path.

The premise is you choose an anime, and pick a slot for your OC (original character) then add in a brief description and bio in said chapter and then we're off to the races!

Think of it as a big collab story with branching alternative paths..like a choose your own adventure!

[RULES]

1. NO SMUT. This isn't a fetishy story like I normally write. Romance and fade to black sex scenes are fine...but keep in mind this is NOT erotica.

2. Please try to keep the canon anime/etc. characters as in character and as believable as possible. Accuracy to their personalities and lore is KEY!

3. Please write coherently and show some effort. No one liners!

4. More than one OC can be introduced! By anyone! Just try to flesh them out and they can be introduced at any time during the plot! If you want you can message me or include a short description of them within their intro chapter!

Have fun!
